title: 109_s467
content: The "Terrorism Risk Insurance Extension Act of 2005" extends the Terrorism Risk Insurance Program until 2007. Amendments are made to ensure mandatory availability of the program for each entity during each Program Year. Additionally, defined terms are amended. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Extension Act of 2005 extends the program until 2007, with defined terms amended to include Program Year 4 and 5. Exclusions from covered lines now include commercial automobile insurance. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Extension Act of 2005 extends the program until 2007, with amendments to covered lines such as excluding commercial automobile insurance and adding directors and officers liability insurance. Insurer deductibles are also adjusted for Program Year 4. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Extension Act of 2005 extends the program until 2007, with amendments to covered lines. Insurer deductibles are adjusted for Program Year 4, 5, and the Transition Period. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Extension Act of 2005 extends the program until 2007 with adjustments to insured loss shared compensation and aggregate retention amounts. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Extension Act of 2005 extends the program until 2007 with adjustments to insured loss shared compensation and aggregate retention amounts. The Act specifies new aggregate retention amounts for Program Year 4 and 5, limiting the total amount for insurers based on insured losses during those years. The Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to include adjustments to subparagraphs (A) through (E) and to replace references to subparagraphs (A), (B), or (C) with "any of subparagraphs (A) through (E)". SEC. 6. PROGRAM TRIGGER. Amends the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 to set a threshold for compensation in case of certified acts of terrorism after March 31, 2006. No compensation will be paid unless industry insured losses exceed $50,000,000 in Program Year 4 or $100,000,000 in Program Year 5. SEC. 7. LITIGATION MANAGEMENT. SEC. 7. LITIGATION MANAGEMENT. Amends the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 to apply procedures and requirements established by the Secretary to any cause of action. SEC. 8. ANALYSIS AND REPORT ON TERRORISM RISK COVERAGE CONDITIONS AND SOLUTIONS. Section 108 of the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 is amended to require the President's Working Group on Financial Markets to analyze the availability and affordability of insurance for terrorism risk, including coverage for various events. A report must be submitted by September 30, 2006 to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. The President's Working Group on Financial Markets must report its findings on insurance availability and affordability for terrorism risk to the Senate and House Committees on Banking and Financial Services.
